Function Documentation

int main (  int  argc,
char *  argv[]
) 
 

main

Description: This is the main function which begins and ends execution of the GNAT program.

Precondition:
None
Postcondition:
The program is terminating.
Parameters:
argc,: This variable is used to indicate how many arguments were supplied when the program was executed.
argv,: This variable is an array of char arrays which contain the arguments supplied when the program was executed.
Returns:
int: This value is used by the operating system to determine if the application was closed properly or not.
Limitations: None

Variable Documentation

const quint32 SAVEFILE_MAGICNUM = 0xA7B4ED63
 

This const is used to indicate that a file is usable by this program.

The first 4 bytes of a file must match this number to be loaded into the GNAT program.
